question: A patient is on heparin, which is an anticoagulant. In case of heparin overdose, bleeding can occur. This bleeding can be controlled by administering which of the following drugs as an antidote to this patient?
What is the process in which antigen-antibody (Ag-Ab) complexes are phagocytosed much more efficiently in the presence of C3b known as?
Alpha thalassemia presents in four different clinical conditions because of the presence of how many copies of genes?
"A thymus-derived cell that participates in a variety of cell mediated immune reactions". Which cell does this statement define?
Which system reaches the functional state first in the embryo?
A woman has a mechanical heart valve and takes warfarin. What advice should she receive regarding her anti-thrombotic medication in pregnancy?

answers.option: Warfarin should be replaced with aspirin at high doses
Warfarin should be discontinued and supplementary vitamin A should be taken everyday throughout the pregnancy
Warfarin should be discontinued until the third trimester
All the medications that affect the blood should be avoided
Warfarin should be replaced with heparin

question: A young male brought to the emergency room was in an unconscious state following an injection dose of a medicine given by a general practitioner. On examination, the patient was diagnosed with anaphylactic shock. Which of the following is the main causative factor for the mentioned condition?
Which of the following is inhibited by aminocaproic acid?
Which of the following is the most abundant plasma protein?
An outbreak of septicemia by Staphylococcus aureus occurred in a children's ward. Where is the causative organism usually found as part of the normal flora?
Aspirin differs from other nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) in what aspect?

answers.option: Unlike other NSAIDs, aspirin can arrest the progress of arthritis
Unlike aspirin, NSAIDs are reversible inhibitors of cyclooxygenase
Analgesic action of aspirin is due to the decrease in PGE₂ synthesis while other NSAIDs have no action on this prostaglandin
Unlike other NSAIDs, aspirin inhibits both the cyclooxygenase and lipoxygenase pathways
Interstitial nephritis can only result from aspirin

question: Through which process do reticulocytes enter peripheral blood circulation from bone marrow?
How does aspirin inhibit platelet aggregation?

answers.option: By irreversible inhibition of cyclooxygenase pathway in endothelial cells
When it is given at 60 - 80 g/day doses
By reversible inhibition of cyclooxygenase pathway for the lifetime of the platelets
Because it inhibits TXA₂ production in platelets for 3 - 7 days
By irreversible inhibition of lipooxygenase pathway

question: What does a bacteriostatic agent do?

What is Blackwater fever a complication of?

What is the cancerous mutation of myelogenous or lymphogenous cells called?
Which of the following regarding ceruloplasmin is correct?
Which of these is a clotting factor that requires activation and is dependent on vitamin K?
Defensins are highly positively charged cationic peptides that perform which of the following functions?

answers.option: Help in the formation of superoxide

question: What is deferoxamine a specific antidote of?
What does a deficiency of factor VIII cause?
Epstein-Barr virus causes which type of malignancy in African children?
What combination of blood groups leads to erythroblastosis fetalis?

answers.option: When the mother is O+ and fetus is O-
When the mother is Rh- and fetus is Rh+
When the mother is A+ and fetus is B-
When the mother is AB+ and fetus is AB-
When the mother is B+ and fetus is O+

question: The fibroblast used to heal wounds is derived from which of the following?

Glycine and succinyl CoA combine to form delta-aminolevulinic acid in the presence of which enzyme?
What are growth factors usually made of?
Hemolytic disease of newborn due to Rh incompatibility is caused by which type of hypersensitivity?
How does histamine cause increased vascular leakage?

answers.option: Increased margination of leukocytes at the site of injury

question: Human T-cell leukemia virus type-1 (HTLV-1) affects which inflammatory cells?
Which of the following is a unique stain used in histological studies?

answers.option: Basophilia (blue stain) for DNA in ribosomes
Azurophilia (purple stain) for lysosome of WBCs

question: For malaria, sporozoites are injected into humans beings. The exo-erythrocytic cycle takes place in which organ of the body?
In malignant tumors, what does the term "loss of polarity" mean?

answers.option: Altered nuclear cytoplasmic ratio of cancer cells
Formation of tumors against normal cells
More than 10 mitoses/10 high power fields
Markedly disturbed orientation of cancer cells

question: In reticuloendothelial cells, what initially degrades heme?
Innate immunity is considered to be the first line of defense against many microorganisms. Which of the following is a major component of this immunity?

Kala-azar is found in most tropical and subtropical countries and is transferred by the sand-fly. What is its causative organism?
What condition are macro-ovalocytes in a peripheral blood smear seen in?
What is the mechanism of action of penicillin?

answers.option: Activation of endogenous proteases, destroying bacterial cell wall
Activation of endogenous phospholipases, destroying bacterial cell wall
Activation of exogenous proteases, destroying bacterial cell wall
Inhibition of transpeptidation in the cell wall
Inhibition of beta-lactamase in the cell wall

question: Which of the following is a major mediator of an anaphylactic reaction?

What is the movement of leukocytes to the site of an injurious stimulus called?
What is the normal percentage of neutrophils in the adult human?
What is 1 gram of pure hemoglobin capable of combining with?
Which one of the following substances is found in the specific cytoplasmic granules of neutrophils?
Which of the following is most likely to lead to a patient presenting with bleeding?
How does penicillin kill bacterial cells?

answers.option: By inhibiting the folic acid synthesis

question: What is the other name for cobalamin?
Pernicious anemia is a type of megaloblastic anemia. What may cause it?

Porphyria results in the accumulation of a unique pattern of intermediates caused by the deficiency of which of the following?
Regarding blood grouping, what does an Rh-positive individual possess?
Regarding carcinogens, which of the following statements is correct?

answers.option: No promotor is required for direct acting chemical carcinogen
Most of the known carcinogens are metabolized by cytochrome P-450
All carcinogens are some form of ionic radiation

question: Which of the following regarding HbH is correct?

answers.option: Not as severe as β-thalassemia major
Caused by the deletion of three α-globin genes

question: Regarding signalling mechanisms in cell growth, what does "autocrine signalling" mean?

answers.option: Cell responding to signalling molecules brought by blood
Cell responding to signalling molecules that are secreted by adjacent cells
Cell responding to signalling molecules that are secreted by far away cells
Cell responding to signalling molecules that they themselves secreted
Cell responding to signalling molecules brought by lymphatics

question: Why might cancer stem cells be less susceptible to chemotherapy?

answers.option: Cells are mostly in G₀ phase
Growth rate equals that of adjacent normal cells
Because of distant metastasis of tumor

question: Reiter's syndrome is a systemic autoimmune disease triggered by infection with intestinal pathogen. Which triad characterizes this disease?
What causes sickle cell disease?

answers.option: Replacement of valine by a glutamic acid
Point mutation in the 6th codon of the beta globin chain
Decreased synthesis of beta chain of globin

question: The special propensity to collect in tissues undergoing allergic reactions is demonstrated by which of the following types of WBCs?

answers.option: At the highest peak of distribution
At the middle of the peak
To the extreme right of the distribution
To the extreme left of the distribution
Between the median and the mode

question: Deficiency of which of the following causes the hemorrhagic disease of the newborn?

answers.option: An individual who harbors a potential pathogen and can be a source of infection to others
An individual with pathogens in sites that are normally colonized in others
An individual who is asymptomatic and thus cannot transmit any infection
A carrier is one who harbors a usual pathogen
An individual who is a carrier can carry a greater load than normal

question: What is the generation time of Escherichia coli in a lab?

answers.option: Activation of RBC to eliminate the offending agent
Accumulation of B-cells at the site of injury
Transmigration of the plasma, and red blood cells

question: What is the major form of vitamin B12 found in human tissue and mitochondria?

Which one of the following plasma proteins helps in the transport of free fatty acids in the blood stream?
Which specific term is used when a biocide is able to kill bacteria?
Which stage of P. falciparum is crescent shaped?
Which type of epidemiological method investigates and evaluates preventative and therapeutic measures?
Regarding β-thalassemia major, which of the following is the most relevant?

answers.option: Anemia is due to decreased erythropoietin
Iron overload is due to high levels of hepcidin

Bone marrow transplantation at an early stage is the treatment of choice

question: A 45-year-old man develops a myocardial infarction. His condition improves and he is discharged from the hospital. He is then prescribed 325 mg aspirin daily. This drug inhibits platelet aggregation by decreasing the production of which of the following?

A 55-year-old man is diagnosed with pulmonary embolism. He is admitted to the hospital and started on heparin therapy. The anticoagulant effect of this drug would be the most appropriately assessed by which of the following laboratory values?

A 60-year-old man with severe chest pain is unresponsive to sublingual nitroglycerin. A thrombolytic therapy is initiated. If streptokinase is given to this patient, it may produce thrombolysis after binding which of the following proteins?

A 60-year-old woman had a mitral valve replacement and was placed on anticoagulants and prophylactics following her surgery. Five days after her surgery, she developed an erythematous rash on her thigh. Two days after the rash appeared, a large hemorrhage bulla then began to form in the area of the rash. Which of the following medications most likely caused the rash?
A 7-year-old child has accidentally overdosed on iron supplements. Which of the following agents can be used as an antidote in this child?
A child is suffering from chronic granulomatous disease. He has a genetic deficiency due to which he is more prone to infections, especially staphylococcal infection. Why is this?

answers.option: Absence of cofactors such as iodine and bromine

question: A middle-aged female with a known case of rheumatoid arthritis consulted her physician during her follow-up visit. answers.option: Chronic blood transfusion and low hepcidin levels

answers.option: Reticular fibers are present in parenchyma
There is a dense medulla present
All of the options are true

question: During the development of red blood cells, a cell is formed having 34% of hemoglobin content, a condensed nucleus, with its endoplasmic reticulum reabsorbed. Which of the following is that cell?

answers.option: No agglutinogens, agglutinins A and B
Agglutinogens A & B, agglutinins A & B

question: Hemoglobin is broken down into heme and globin followed by the conversion of biliverdin into bilirubin. Inside the hepatic system, what does bilirubin gets conjugated with?
A woman with damage to the mitral valve of the heart is placed on warfarin therapy. Which of the following may be used to follow the anticoagulant activity?

answers.option: The prothrombin time test/ International normalized ratio (PT/INR)

question: Which of the following mucin antigens is present in both ovarian and breast cancers?

answers.option: The two layers of dorsal mesogastrium
The two layers of ventral mesogastrium
